item.title: Cartoon by Mike Smith
item.description: Mike Smith cartoon on shutdown and elections.

item.title: China’s crackdown on Christians will backfire
item.description: The more the state persecutes believers, the more resilient and widespread their faith becomes.

item.title: Presidential power and the Supreme Court’s own stature ride on this case
item.description: The momentous tariffs case will undermine or buttress the Constitution’s separation of powers.

item.title: The original Trump ballroom design was good. The expansion? Less so.
item.description: A big tent might be great politics, but it is an inadequate setting for large presidential gatherings.

item.title: Trump now plays by China’s rules
item.description: The U.S. wins through openness and innovation, not tariffs and centralized planning.

item.title: The Toronto Blue Jays are global heavyweights. Just like Canada.
item.description: Our relationship with the U.S. is being tested by tariffs, but our country is more united than ever.

item.title: Trading in the trade policy
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on U.S.-China summit.

item.title: What the SNAP fight is really about
item.description: Food stamps are a way to feed hungry kids, not a political bargaining chip or an engine for growth.

item.title: The unexpected benefits of moving to a long-term care facility
item.description: Moving to a nursing home or assisted-living facility doesn’t have to feel like a loss.

item.title: Who is really behind London’s decline?
item.description: Readers respond to Post articles and commentary.

item.title: Trump and Xi flexed. Who won?
item.description: The leaders share an affinity for great-power-style foreign policy. That’s working — for now.

item.title: Trump wants to admit more Chinese students. Here’s why he shouldn’t.
item.description: Beijing’s systemic economic espionage at universities puts U.S. research and technology at risk.

item.title: What Trump’s ‘12’ of a summit with Xi yielded
item.description: The trade war truce is welcome — and buys the U.S. time.

item.title: At least some Democrats are trying to figure out what went wrong
item.description: Democrats’ assessment of why they’re losing voters is healthy, but is the party willing to change?

item.title: Billions in treasure lie on the seafloor. Finders keepers?
item.description: As treasure hunters pursue gold and silver, they both aid and compete with archeologists.

item.title: Why the U.S. is losing the battle for hearts and minds
item.description: The U.S. is dismantling its best tools to counter Chinese, Russian and Iranian propaganda.

item.title: Pennsylvania Democrats know the truth about demonizing Trump
item.description: Gov. Josh Shapiro and the Democratic state party leader are focused on winning back lost voters.

item.title: A turning point in the government shutdown
item.description: Piecemeal bills are a waste of time. Just fund the whole government.

item.title: The proper reaction to the ‘woke’ conundrum in higher education
item.description: Readers respond to Post articles and commentary.
